org.arl.fjage.auth

Interface Firewall

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFirewall, AllowAfterAuth, AllowAll, DenyAll

    public interface Firewall
    Firewall interface for API access to fjage master containers. Each connection to a master container should and will be assigned its own Firewall instance. Firewall instances should be considered stateful.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean authenticate(java.lang.String creds)
      Authenticates peer using specified credentials.
      boolean permit(AgentID aid)
      Checks whether a message intended for the specified agent/topic may be sent over this connection.
      boolean permit(JsonMessage rq)
      Checks whether a JSON message can be accepted over this connection.
      void signoff()
      Called when the connection is closed.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        boolean authenticate(java.lang.String creds)
        Authenticates peer using specified credentials.
        Parameters:
        creds - credentials, or null if logging out.
        Returns:
        true if authenticated successfully, false otherwise.

      • permit

        boolean permit(JsonMessage rq)
        Checks whether a JSON message can be accepted over this connection.
        Parameters:
        rq - incoming JSON request.
        Returns:
        true to accept, false to reject.

      • permit

        boolean permit(AgentID aid)
        Checks whether a message intended for the specified agent/topic may be sent over this connection.
        Parameters:
        aid - recipient agent/topic for the message.
        Returns:
        true to permit, false to reject.

      • signoff

        void signoff()
        Called when the connection is closed. The Firewall instance should perform cleanup.
